result: C) understanding, by acceptance. The poem I, too is a powerful statement about the experiences of being black in America during the 1930s and the ways in which racism affected people's lives. In this case, the character is describing how he has learned to cope with the racist practice of being sent to eat in the kitchen when company comes by accepting it as a part of his life and finding joy in eating well and growing strong. This attitude of acceptance allows him to see the beauty in himself and in America, despite the discrimination he faces.
